Package ohos.agp.components.element

Class LayerElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.element.Element
      • ohos.agp.components.element.LayerElement

  • public class LayerElement
extends Element
    Provides an element that manages a list of other elements.

    These elements are drawn in list order. Therefore, the element with the largest index will be drawn on the top of the layer. That element can be defined in an XML file with the xml-tag, and other elements in the LayerElement are defined in a nested xml-tag. A LayerElement has its own bounds and padding that are common for all internal elements. Every internal element can also have its own bounds, inlays, and size. These properties allow you to position the internal elements within the LayerElement.

    Since:
    7

      • setElementSize

        public boolean setElementSize​(int index,
                              int width,
                              int height)
        Sets an explicit width and height for the specified element within this LayerElement.
        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the index of the element. The value must be in the range between 0 and getCount().
        width - Indicates the width to set, in pixels. The value -1 means that the optimal width will be used.
        height - Indicates the height to set, in pixels. The value -1 means that the optimal height will be used.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the operation is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        7

      • setPaddingMode

        public void setPaddingMode​(int mode)
        Sets the padding mode for this LayerElement.

        The padding mode will affect the bounds of each layer in this LayerElement.

        Parameters:
        mode - Indicates the padding mode to set. The value can be DEPENDENT or INDEPENDENT. The default value is INDEPENDENT.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the value of mode is not DEPENDENT or INDEPENDENT.
        Since:
        7

      • getPaddingMode

        public int getPaddingMode​()
        Obtains the padding mode of this LayerElement.
        Returns:
        Returns the padding mode, which can be DEPENDENT or INDEPENDENT.
        Since:
        7
